name: 256 Wizards
description:
UPDATES

2017-04-08

  • more graphics: keys, cobwebs, bones, glass...
  • fixed a couple rare dungeon generation bugs: blocked passages; keys on the other side of locked gates

2017-04-06

  • first public release!
WHAT IS THIS GAME?

256 Wizards is an action RPG/roguelike inspired by old 16-bit DOS games, and Mark Brown's video on Kishotenketsu as a game design philosophy.

the game is in super-early development. expect crashes.

up to 5 players can play simultaneously, if you have four wired XBox controllers to plug in.

use the Konami code (up up down down left right left right B A) before beginning the game to go to the debugging level.

256 Wizards is made in C# with MonoGame, using a custom framework. you will need the .NET 4.6 runtime, freely available from Microsoft. if you have Windows 10 and/or play a lot of games, you probably already have this.
